p:slide.p:title: Entities
p:slide.p: There are several sorts of entity. The most common are character entities.
Character entities are normally used when:

ul.li: You can't type the character with your keyboard
The character can't be expressed in the encoding*
XML requires that you use it

p:slide.p: There are three ways to write an entity:

p:slide.p:title: Aside: Hexadecimal

ul.li: Used a lot in computer science because it's logically close to binary (base 2)*
Because we don't have enough digits, we use A-F to represent 10-15

So…
The copyright (©) symbol is character number 169.
160 is 10 * 16 so we write that as A0
9 is just 9 so, adding, we get A9

p:slide.p: * When you get right down to the smallest details, computers only use binary.
